workflow.name: Automate Instagram comment responses with Google Sheets & CRM tracking
workflow.description:
*This workflow contains community nodes that are only compatible with the self-hosted version of n8n.*

## üéØ Overview
This n8n workflow template automates the process of monitoring Instagram comments and sending predefined responses based on specific comment keywords. It integrates Instagram's Graph API with Google Sheets to manage comment responses and maintains an interaction log for customer relationship management (CRM) purposes.

## üîß Workflow Components
The workflow consists of **9 main nodes** organized into two primary sections:

### üì° Section 1: Webhook Verification
- ‚úÖ **Get Verification** (Webhook node)
- üîÑ **Respond to Verification Message** (Respond to Webhook node)

### ü§ñ Section 2: Auto Comment Response
- üì¨ **Insta Update** (Webhook node)
- ‚ùì **Check if update is of comment?** (Switch node)
- üë§ **Comment if of other user** (If node)
- üìä **Comment List** (Google Sheets node)
- üí¨ **Send Message for Comment** (HTTP Request node)
- üìù **Add Interaction in Sheet (CRM)** (Google Sheets node)

## üõ†Ô∏è Prerequisites and Setup Requirements

### 1. üîµ Meta/Facebook Developer Setup

#### üì± Create Facebook App
> üìã **Action Items:**
> - [ ] Navigate to [Facebook Developers](https://developers.facebook.com/)
> - [ ] Click "Create App" and select "Business" type
> - [ ] Configure the following products:
>   - ‚úÖ Instagram Graph API
>   - ‚úÖ Facebook Login for Business  
>   - ‚úÖ Webhooks

#### üîê Required Permissions

Configure the following permissions in your Meta app:
| `instagram_basic` | üìñ Read Instagram account profile info and media
| `instagram_manage_comments` | üí¨ Create, delete, and manage comments
| `instagram_manage_messages` | üì§ Send and receive Instagram messages 
| `pages_show_list` | üìÑ Access connected Facebook pages

#### üé´ Access Token Generation
> ‚ö†Ô∏è **Important Setup:**+
> - [ ] Use Facebook's Graph API Explorer
> - [ ] Generate a User Access Token with required permissions
> - [ ] ‚ö° **Important**: Tokens expire periodically and need refreshing

### 2. üåê Webhook Configuration

#### üîó Setup Webhook URL
> üìå **Configuration Checklist:**
> - [ ] In Meta App Dashboard, navigate to **Products ‚Üí Webhooks**
> - [ ] Subscribe to **Instagram** object
> - [ ] Configure webhook URL: `your-n8n-domain/webhook/instagram`
> - [ ] Set verification token (use "test" or create secure token)
> - [ ] Select webhook fields:
>   - ‚úÖ **comments** - For comment notifications
>   - ‚úÖ **messages** - For DM notifications (if needed)

#### ‚úÖ Webhook Verification Process
The workflow handles Meta's webhook verification automatically:
- üì° Meta sends GET request with `hub.challenge` parameter
- üîÑ Workflow responds with the challenge value to confirm subscription

### 3. üìä Google Sheets Setup

Example - https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ONPKJZOpQTSxbasVcCB7oBjbZcCyAm9gZ-UNPoXM21A/edit?usp=sharing 

#### üìã Create Response Management Sheet
Set up a Google Sheets document with the following structure:

**üìù Sheet 1 - Comment Responses:**
| Column | Description | Example |
|--------|-------------|---------|
| üí¨ Comment | Trigger keywords | `"auto", "info", "help"` |
| üìù Message | Corresponding response message | `"Thanks for your comment! We'll get back to you soon."` |

**üìà Sheet 2 - Interaction Log:**
| Column | Description | Purpose |
|--------|-------------|---------|
| ‚è∞ Time | Timestamp of interaction | Track when interactions occur |
| üÜî User Id | Instagram user ID | Identify unique users |
| üë§ Username | Instagram username | Human-readable identification |
| üìù Note | Additional notes or error messages | Debugging and analytics |

---

## üîß Built By - akash@codescale.tech

main.node: Check if update is of comment?

user.name: Akash Kankariya
user.bio: I'm a developer with 5 years of experience in Python and Node.js. Over the past year, I've been building workflows to streamline operations for my team. I have also developed RAG chatbots, AI agents, and WhatsApp automation. If you need any help with N8N workflows, let's connect over a call and solve it together!

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
